וַיָּבֹ֞א <WH935> way·yā·ḇō came ( The Call of Gideon) מַלְאַ֣ךְ <WH4397> mal·’aḵ Then the angel ( Or Angel; also in verses 12, 20, 21, and 22; corresponding pronouns may also be capitalized.) יְהוָ֗ה <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ <WH3427> way·yê·šeḇ and sat down תַּ֤חַת <WH8478> ta·ḥaṯ under הָֽאֵלָה֙ <WH424> hā·’ê·lāh the oak ( Or terebinth or great tree; also in verse 19) אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ’ă·šer - בְּעָפְרָ֔ה <WH6084> bə·‘ā·p̄ə·rāh in Ophrah אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that לְיוֹאָ֖שׁ <WH3101> lə·yō·w·’āš belonged to Joash אֲבִ֣י <WH33> ’ă·ḇî vvv הָֽעֶזְרִ֑י <WH33> hā·‘ez·rî the Abiezrite, וְגִדְע֣וֹן <WH1439> wə·ḡiḏ·‘ō·wn Gideon בְּנ֗וֹ <WH1121> bə·nōw where his son חֹבֵ֤ט <WH2251> ḥō·ḇêṭ was threshing חִטִּים֙ <WH2406> ḥiṭ·ṭîm wheat בַּגַּ֔ת <WH1660> bag·gaṯ in a winepress לְהָנִ֖יס <WH5127> lə·hā·nîs to hide it מִפְּנֵ֥י <WH6440> mip·pə·nê from מִדְיָֽן׃ <WH4080> miḏ·yān the Midianites.
